newsitem.title: USA: N.J. Turnpike says approves traffic, revenue study.
newsitem.headline: N.J. Turnpike says approves traffic, revenue study.

text.p: New Jersey Turnpike Authority said Wednesday it awarded a contract to Wilber Smith Associates to study traffic and revenues for the agency.
The study will project future revenues and traffic flow, and review implementation of electronic toll collection and other capital projects, the agency said.
"This study is not a prelude to a toll increase," the authority's executive director, Edward Gross, said in a statement.

Gross added that the authority's plan to raise approximately $400 million in 1997 for turnpike capital projects was outlined in a 1995 finance plan. "The authority is acting in a manner consistent with the plan, which provides for toll stabilization through 1998."
